programme.title: Masters of the Game
programme.desc: Touré interviews living legends about their craft, brilliance, and road to become successful masters.

programme.title: The Grio Weekly With Natasha Alford
programme.sub-title: The Grio Weekly With Natasha Alford
programme.desc: Natasha chats with Sonya Renee Taylor - a New York Times best-selling author, world-renowned activist and thought leader on racial justice, body liberation and transformational change.

programme.title: Dear Culture With Panama Jackson
programme.sub-title: Is Usher a True R&B Legend?
programme.desc: Following the popularity of his "Tiny Desk" appearance, many are analyzing the music catalog of Usher; Panama Jackson is joined by music writer Matthew Allen to answer the question of whether Usher is an R&B legend.

programme.title: Dear Culture With Panama Jackson
programme.sub-title: Boomerang: The Movie vs. the Soundtrack
programme.desc: A discussion of whether the movie "Boomerang," at its 30th anniversary is still the cult classic it once was or if the soundtrack hits harder than the movie; author Bassey Ikpi joins Panama Jackson to talk about it.

programme.title: Dear Culture With Panama Jackson
programme.sub-title: Will Owning Our Own Media Platforms Change the Game?
programme.desc: After his recent acquisition of the Black News Channel, entrepreneur Byron Allen -- owner of theGrio -- discusses the importance of Black representation in media.

programme.title: The First Family
programme.desc: The first couple are not invited to their oldest friends' annual blowout barbecue.

programme.title: Mr. Box Office
programme.desc: Hollywood film star Marcus Jackson thinks he is invincible until he attacks the paparazzi and must serve his community service sentence as a high school teacher for an unruly bunch of students.

programme.title: Writing Black With Maiysha Kai
programme.desc: Maiysha Kai talks with Black storytellers across the diaspora, speaking candidly about process, popular culture, publishing and how race inherently inspires and informs their work.
